name: ğŸš A drone flying itself to take videos
explanation: Autonomous drones use AI for obstacle avoidance, path planning, and tracking subjects. They make real-time decisions about flight without human control.

name: ğŸ¥ The software that helps doctors spot diseases in scans
explanation: Medical AI analyses thousands of images to learn patterns of diseases, helping doctors identify conditions like cancer or fractures more accurately.

name: ğŸ’¬ Chatbot that answers your questions online
explanation: Modern chatbots use natural language processing AI to understand your questions and generate relevant responses, learning from millions of conversations.

name: ğŸ® A video game that changes difficulty based on your skill
explanation: Adaptive difficulty systems use AI to monitor your performance and dynamically adjust the game's challenge level to keep you engaged.

name: âœï¸ An app that writes stories or poems for you
explanation: Generative AI models have been trained on vast amounts of text to understand language patterns and create original creative writing based on prompts.

name: ğŸ­ Deepfake videos that swap faces realistically
explanation: Deepfakes use deep learning AI to analyse facial features and movements, then convincingly map one person's face onto another in video footage.

name: ğŸ“° A printed newspaper article
explanation: A newspaper is static printed text written by human journalists. It doesn't adapt, learn, or change based on who reads it.

name: ğŸ¥« A hand-powered can opener
explanation: A can opener is a simple mechanical tool that uses leverage and a cutting wheel. It requires human power and doesn't make any decisions.

name: ğŸ”¢ A regular calculator that only adds and subtracts
explanation: A basic calculator follows fixed mathematical rules programmed into it. It cannot learn new operations or solve problems it wasn't designed for.

name: âŒš A mechanical wristwatch
explanation: A mechanical watch uses springs, gears, and an escapement mechanism to keep time. It's pure precision engineering with no computational intelligence.

name: ğŸš´ A bike that you pedal to move
explanation: A bicycle converts your pedalling energy into motion through gears and a chain. It's entirely human-powered with no electronic components.

name: ğŸ“¸ A regular camera that uses film
explanation: A film camera uses optics and chemical processes to capture images. Unlike digital cameras with AI features, it has no computational processing.

name: ğŸ’¡ A light bulb you turn on with a switch
explanation: A light bulb is a simple electrical circuit. When you flip the switch, electricity flows through the filament to produce light - no intelligence needed.

name: ğŸš¥ A traffic light controlled by timers, not sensors
explanation: Timer-based traffic lights follow a fixed schedule regardless of actual traffic conditions. They don't sense, learn, or adapt to their environment.

name: ğŸµ The app suggesting new songs after you listen to music
explanation: Music apps like Spotify use AI to analyse your listening habits, find patterns in the songs you like, and recommend new music you're likely to enjoy.

name: ğŸ“¢ Online ads that seem to know what you like
explanation: These ads use AI to track your browsing behaviour and predict what products you might want to buy, creating a personalised advertising experience.
